articles.author: BILL BARROW
articles.description: ASHEVILLE, N.C. (AP) — Donald Trump made little effort to stay on message Wednesday at a rally in North Carolina that his campaign billed as a big economic address, mixing pledges to slash energy prices and “unleash economic abundance” with familiar off-script tangents on Democratic nominee Kamala Harris’ laugh, the mechanics of wind energy and President Joe Biden’s son.
articles.title: Trump’s campaign called it an economic address. He made big promises but mostly veered off topic

articles.author: DAN MERICA, NICHOLAS RICCARDI and CHRIS MEGERIAN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden, watching tens of thousands of migrants from Central America reach the U.S.-Mexico border just a few months into his administration, tapped his second-in-command to help address the influx — a decision that has exposed Vice President Kamala Harris to one of her biggest political liabilities.
articles.title: Presented with rise in border crossings, Kamala Harris chose a long-term approach to the problem

articles.author: ABBY SEWELL
articles.description: DOHA, Qatar (AP) — A top Hamas official said the Palestinian militant group is losing faith in the United States’ ability to mediate a cease-fire in Gaza ahead of a new round of talks scheduled for this week amid mounting pressure to bring an end to the 10-month-old war with Israel.
articles.title: Top Hamas official says group is losing faith in US as mediator in Gaza cease-fire talks

articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Hunter Biden asked the U.S. ambassador to Italy for help regarding an energy project a Ukrainian gas company was pursuing while his father was vice president, according to The New York Times.
articles.title: Hunter Biden reportedly sought US government help for Ukrainian gas company Burisma

articles.author: SEJAL GOVINDARAO
articles.description: PHOENIX (AP) — An informational pamphlet for Arizona voters who will decide in the fall whether to guarantee a constitutional right to an abortion can refer to a fetus as an “unborn human being,” the state's highest court ruled Wednesday.
articles.title: Ruling: Fetus can be referred to as 'unborn human being' in Arizona abortion measure voter pamphlet

articles.author: DÁNICA COTO
articles.description: TOA BAJA, Puerto Rico (AP) — Ernesto strengthened into a hurricane Wednesday as it dropped torrential rain on Puerto Rico and left half of all customers in the U.S.
articles.title: Ernesto becomes a hurricane after pummeling northeast Caribbean and knocking out power in the region

articles.author: JAMIE STENGLE
articles.description: DALLAS (AP) — The State Fair of Texas is laying down a new rule before millions of visitors flock through the gates for corn dogs, deep-fried delights and a friendly wave from a five-story cowboy named Big Tex: No guns allowed.
articles.title: The State Fair of Texas is banning firearms, drawing threats of legal action from Republican AG

articles.author: ILLIA NOVIKOV and EMMA BURROWS
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukrainian forces pushed on with their major cross-border advance into Russia’s Kursk region for a second week Wednesday, claiming that they took more ground, captured more Russian prisoners and destroyed a bomber in attacks on military airfields.
articles.title: Ukraine says it has taken more ground and prisoners during its advance into Russia border region

articles.author: CHRISTINA LARSON
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The ancient ritual meaning of Stonehenge is still a mystery, but researchers are one step closer to understanding how the famous stone circle was created.
articles.title: Stonehenge's 'altar stone' originally came from Scotland and not Wales, new research shows

articles.author: MARIA CHENG
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — The World Health Organization declared the mpox outbreaks in Congo and elsewhere in Africa a global emergency on Wednesday, with cases confirmed among children and adults in more than a dozen countries and a new form of the virus spreading.
articles.title: WHO declares mpox outbreaks in Africa a global health emergency as a new form of the virus spreads
